Jigar Patel wrote:
>
>
> Hi...
>
> Anybody give some detail about ExtractorHTML file....
> I want to know about what exactly it does internally and flow of this
> program...
>







Unfortunately, the only documentation in this case is the code itself.  
The code is hard to follow since it turns on some rather involved regexes.

>
> I want to know that how it fetches links from the HTML page...
> I need to know complete detail of it...
> Will anybody help me...
>





You might start with the Extractor superclass so you get your bearings: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/Extractor.html.  
Next, study the comments that surround each of the regexes listed at the 
head of the class starting here: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/ExtractorHTML.html#61.  
The comments go out of their way to enumerate the content of each of the 
matching regex groups.  The general pattern is regexing over the file 
with the RELEVANT_TAG_EXTRACTOR pattern switching off the type of tag found.

See http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#N104D4, in 
particular section 11.2 for more on processors and ReplayCharSequence.

St.Ack



> .
>
>
